    • Field Detail

      • R

        public static final Interval R
        this class defines the interval object, that will be used to implement interval valued functions. As such, this class implements the usual arithmetic operations, but performs them over intervals (that is: a lower bound an upper bound)

      • RPOS

        public static final Interval RPOS

      • UNDEFINED

        public static final Interval UNDEFINED

      • add

        public static Interval add​(Interval i1,
                           Interval i2)
        Parameters:
        i1 -
        i2 -
        Returns:
        the sum of the two given intervals using the adition formula: [l1,u1] + [l2,u2] = [l1+l2,u1+u2]

      • substract

        public static Interval substract​(Interval i1,
                                 Interval i2)
        Parameters:
        i1 -
        i2 -
        Returns:
        the interval i1-i2 using the formula: [x,y] - [a,b] = [x,y] + (-[a,b])

        public static Interval div​(Interval i1,
                           Interval i2)
                    throws IntervalException
        Parameters:
        i1 -
        i2 -
        Returns:
        the division of i1 by i2, using the formula: [x,y] / [a,b] = [x,y] x (1 / [a,b])
        Throws:
        IntervalException

        public static Interval biUnion​(Interval i1,
                               Interval i2)
                        throws IntervalException
        Parameters:
        i1 -
        i2 -
        Returns:
        the union of the two specified intervals, unless they don't intersect
        Throws:
        IntervalException - if the interval don't intersect

      • inv

        public Interval inv​()
             throws IntervalException
        Returns:
        the inverse of the current interval, according to the formula: 1 / [x,y] = [1/x,1/y] if 0 not in [x,y] [-infinity , 1/x] if y = 0 [1/y, infinity] if x = 0 [-inf,1/x] U [1/y,inf] = [-inf,+inf] = R , otherwise
        Throws:
        IntervalException

      • invLeft

        public Interval invLeft​()
                 throws IntervalException
        Returns:
        the sama result as inv, except fot the case of intervals strictly containing 0, where [-inf,1/x] is returned
        Throws:
        IntervalException

      • invRight

        public Interval invRight​()
                  throws IntervalException
        Returns:
        the sama result as inv, except fot the case of intervals strictly containing 0, where [1/y,inf] is returned
        Throws:
        IntervalException

      • neg

        public Interval neg​()

      • applyAffineFunction

        public Interval applyAffineFunction​(Interval a,
                                    Interval b)
        Parameters:
        a - slope interval
        b - intercept interval
        Returns:
        apply an affine function to the current interval, given its interval valued slope and intercept, using the simple formula: f(a,b,x) = a * x + b

      • intersect

        public Interval intersect​(Interval i)
                   throws IntervalException
        Throws:
        IntervalException
